com.edugility.liquiunit

Class DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • com.edugility.liquiunit.DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestRule

    public class DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule
extends ExternalResource
    An ExternalResource that wraps JUnit tests with a DataSourceDatabaseTester to ensure that the underlying database is populated appropriately with test data.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    dbUnit, DataSourceDatabaseTester

      • DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule

        public DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule(DataSourceDatabaseTester tester)
        Creates a DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule.

        This constructor assumes that the supplied DataSourceDatabaseTester is completely configured and this DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule will therefore perform no further configuration. Please see in particular the getDataSet(Description) method, which will consequently have no effect.

        Parameters:
        tester - the DataSourceDatabaseTester to which most operations will delegate; must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if tester is null

    • Method Detail

      • before

        public void before()
            throws Exception
        Finds an appropriate IDataSet for the affiliated DataSourceDatabaseTester and installs it immediately before invoking the IDatabaseTester.onSetup() method.

      • apply

        public Statement apply(Statement base,
                       Description description)
        Overrides the ExternalResource.apply(Statement, Description) method to store the supplied Description for usage by the before() method internally and returns the superclass' return value.

        It must be assumed that this method may return null since the superclass documentation does not mention whether the return value must be non-null.

        Specified by:
        apply in interface TestRule
        Overrides:
        apply in class ExternalResource
        Parameters:
        base - the Statement to decorate; the superclass documentation does not define what behavior will occur if this parameter is null
        description - the Description describing the test underway; the superclass documentation does not define what behavior will occur if this parameter is null
        Returns:
        a Statement; possibly null
        See Also:
        before(), ExternalResource.apply(Statement, Description)

      • getDataSet

        protected IDataSet getDataSet(Description description)
                       throws DataSetException,
                              IOException
        Follows various conventions, detailed below, in attempting to locate and instantiate a new IDataSet instance appropriate for the supplied Description.

        This implementation first checks the DataSourceDatabaseTester indirectly or directly supplied to this DataSourceDatabaseTesterRule at construction time to see if it already has a IDataSet implementation installed. If so, then no further action is taken and that IDataSet is returned. (null is returned if the supplied description is null.)

        Otherwise, a classpath resource named datasets/SIMPLE_TEST_CLASS_NAME/TEST_METHOD_NAME.xml is sought using the context classloader, where SIMPLE_TEST_CLASS_NAME is the name of the JUnit test Class currently running and TEST_METHOD_NAME is the name of the JUnit test method currently running.

        If that resource doesn't exist, then a classpath resource named datasets/SIMPLE_TEST_CLASS_NAME.xml is sought using the context classloader, where SIMPLE_TEST_CLASS_NAME is the name of the JUnit test Class currently running.

        Once a resource is located in this manner, its URL is passed to the createDataSet(URL) method, and that method's return value is returned.

        If no resource exists, then null is returned.

        Parameters:
        description - a Description describing the JUnit test being executed; may be null
        Returns:
        an IDataSet instance appropriate for the supplied Description, or null
        Throws:
        DataSetException - if there was an error in constructing the IDataSet
        IOException - if there was an input/output error
        See Also:
        createDataSet(URL)

      • createDataSet

        protected IDataSet createDataSet(URL url)
                          throws DataSetException,
                                 IOException
        Creates a new IDataSet implementation suitable for the supplied URL and returns it.

        This method may return null.

        Overrides of this method are permitted to return null.

        This implementation returns null if a null URL is supplied. Otherwise, a new XmlDataSet is constructed with the supplied URL's affiliated InputStream and returned.

        Parameters:
        url - the URL for which a new IDataSet implementation should be returned; may be null
        Returns:
        a new IDataSet implementation, or null
        Throws:
        DataSetException - if an error occurs during IDataSet construction
        IOException - if an error occurs during the processing of the supplied URL
        See Also:
        getDataSet(Description)

      • closeDataSet

        protected void closeDataSet()
                     throws IOException
        Notionally closes any resources held by the IDataSet created by the createDataSet(URL) method.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during closing
        See Also:
        createDataSet(URL)
